cards.question: What is HTML?
cards.answer: Hypertext Markup Language, a standardized system for tagging text files to achieve font, color, graphic, and hyperlink effects on World Wide Web pages.

cards.question: What is HTML used for?
cards.answer: The Hypertext Markup Language (HTML) is a standard for describing the structure and presentation of information via the Internet.

cards.question: What is boilerplate code?
cards.answer: The 'boilerplate code' is any seemingly repetitive code that shows up again and again in order to get some result that seems like it ought to be much simpler.

cards.question: Sample boilerplate example
cards.answer:
< html >
< head >
< title > My Website! < /title >
< /head >
< body >
< h1 > My Great Web Site < /h1 >
< a href = ”website.com” > Great website < /a >
< /body >
< /html >

cards.question: Why do we need to create index.html file?
cards.answer: Creating an index file is a necessity for anyone who plans to run a website. An index file is the first web page that anyone visiting your website will see, and it need to be named “index.html” in order for web browsers to find it.

cards.question: < DOCTYPE >
cards.answer: Describes the version of html being used.< ! DOCTYPE html > specifies HTML5 which is the most current type.

cards.question: < title >
cards.answer: Defines title that appears in the browser's title bar

cards.question: < body >
cards.answer: All content that appears on the web page shows up between these two tags.

cards.question: < img >
cards.answer: an image tag

cards.question: < img > attribute that tells the computer which .jpg to pull
cards.answer: src = 'image.jpg'

cards.question: < img > attribute that gives a description of the image in case an image can't be viewed
cards.answer: alt = 'this is an image'

cards.question: < img > attribute that specifies dimensions of an image
cards.answer: height=300 or width ='200'

cards.question: What will < figure style ='float:left;' > do?
cards.answer: It will move the image so that it is to the left of any text

cards.question: < a >
cards.answer: hyperlink tag

cards.question: What two tags don't need a closing tag?
cards.answer: < img > and < br >

cards.question: href
cards.answer: Tells your link where you want it to go.

cards.question:
< a href = 'http://www.yahoo.com' > Go to Yahoo! < /a >
Is this a correct hyperlink?
cards.answer: Yes.

cards.question: < a href = 'moreinfo.html' >  For more info from Erika's website  < /a > Is this a correct hyperlink?
cards.answer: Yes.

cards.question: Attribute Basics
cards.answer:
-all HTML tags can have attributes
-provides additional info about an element
-Attributes always come in name/value pairs like: name='value'
-Attribute values are always enclosed in quotes
-Equal sign = between attribute name and value
-Always has a start tag and an end tag

cards.question: What is the difference between html and CSS?
cards.answer:
-HTML: standard markup language for creating Web pages
-HTML stands for Hypertext Markup Language
-Describes the STRUCTURE of Web pages using markup

cards.question: What tag do you use to start a list?
cards.answer: <ul>

cards.question: What tag do you use to specify bullet points in a list?
cards.answer: <li>

cards.question: What does <html lang='en'> establish?
cards.answer: specifies the language,in this case it is en= English

cards.question: How many headings can you have?
cards.answer:
6 headings
< h1 > < /h1 > The CEO
< h2 > < /h2 > VP
< h3 > < /h3 > Director
< h4 >< /h4 > Middle management
< h5 > < /h5 > Lowly assistant
< h6 > < /h6 > Gets coffee for everyone

cards.question: What do the different headings tell you?
cards.answer: Specifies sizes, < h1 > would be the largest because it would be the 'most important'

cards.question: < strong > < /strong >
cards.answer: The tags make the text bold

cards.question: Indentation
cards.answer: The amount each line is spaced in from the margin
